content: I've been calling into the Rust leadership syncs, just generally reporting on what I've seen, but I should probably be asking if anyone has any news to bring up

I'm back online but kinda overwhelmed at the moment. I'll see if I have anything to bring up.
I am kinda frustrated about my RFC being ignored, but not sure what to do about it: https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2714
aah, that sounds like the perfect sort of thing to bring up
fun topic came up today: access control for rust-lang contributors (and doing an overhaul)
there is going to be a follow-up meeting on that specifically
@Shnatsel brought your RFC up on the call. I think @nikomatsakis is going to try to put us in touch with the right people on the libs team to talk to in order to move it forward
yes I am :) let me get on that...
Woah, a reply on my RFC! Stating that I didn't need an RFC in the first place! At last!
As part of safety-dance we've also opened https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/64069 but it looks like it's getting the attention it needs for now
I also need to turn https://github.com/Shnatsel/rust-audit into an RFC for Cargo
@Shnatsel current releases of cargo-audit should support reading Cargo.lock from STDIN too

@Tony Arcieri could you bring this up in the next leadership sync? It seems to be stuck waiting on libs team, and has been pushed back one release already. https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/64069
